_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The deeds that lead to rebirth in a bad: Hurting living creatures with a fist, stone, rod, or sword
Not giving to ascetics or brahmins
Not approaching an ascetic or brahmin to ask for guidance
The deeds that lead to rebirth in a heav: Not habitually hurting living creatures with a fist, stone, rod, or sword
Approaching an ascetic or brahmin to ask for guidance
The qualities that lead to rebirth in a: Being in a low class family
